eventName: The Black Forest Wills A Dream
storyInfo: The funeral was held as planned, but Typhon gradually notices signs of demonic contamination during the procession of ships. Santalla arrives as promised, and halts the funeral along with Typhon. At the most critical moment, the party encounters a northern Snowpriest and his warriors.

attributes.content: The snow's getting heavier.
attributes.name: Ursus Caravan Member

attributes.content: C'mon, take a swig.
attributes.name: Ursus Caravan Guard

attributes.content: Pah. I still regret giving that Sami flagon over to that girl.
attributes.name: Ursus Caravan Member

attributes.content: Forget it. You'd be in serious trouble if the border guards found it.
attributes.name: Ursus Caravan Guard

attributes.content: Besides, do you really believe that a few words inscribed on his drum and flagon are enough to keep someone safe?
attributes.name: Ursus Caravan Guard

attributes.content: In this land of ice and snow, the only thing that can protect us is vodka.
attributes.name: Ursus Caravan Guard

attributes.content: —Well, now it's just vodka, anyway.
attributes.name: Ursus Caravan Guard

attributes.content: That's not what I meant.
attributes.name: Ursus Caravan Member

attributes.content: It's just that... the night before the incident, we were all still sitting together and chatting.
attributes.name: Ursus Caravan Member

attributes.content: Yeah, I remember, the two of you had little sisters who are about the same age.
attributes.name: Ursus Caravan Guard

attributes.content: And he never got a chance to make up with her.
attributes.name: Ursus Caravan Member

attributes.content: So just think of it as me feeling sorry for him.
attributes.name: Ursus Caravan Member

attributes.content: *sigh* I know what it's like. People who've been fighting for so long have so much blood on their hands that they can never go home.
attributes.name: Ursus Caravan Member

attributes.content: But in the end, even after telling us all those stories about his family squabbles, he never told us who they were fighting.
attributes.name: Ursus Caravan Member

attributes.content: They gave their lives to save us, but we never even found out what happened.
attributes.name: Ursus Caravan Member

attributes.content: I should've kept his flagon. Honestly, I don't know how else to honor the memory of these mysterious Sami, other than with something I can touch.
attributes.name: Ursus Caravan Member

attributes.content: ...Hah, maybe I'm just being too sentimental over a bunch of Sami savages.
attributes.name: Ursus Caravan Member

attributes.content: ...Do you still remember what they said when we were chatting that night? That the Sami don't believe that death is the end.
attributes.name: Ursus Caravan Guard

attributes.content: Like, say you think it's a completely windless night, but something still gets blown over. They'd call that the souls of the dead passing by.
attributes.name: Ursus Caravan Guard

attributes.content: Not stupid, if you ask me.
attributes.name: Ursus Caravan Guard

attributes.content: Which? Me, or the Sami superstition?
attributes.name: Ursus Caravan Member

attributes.content: Both.
attributes.name: Ursus Caravan Guard

attributes.content: Alright. Time to call the others and get ready to do some business.
attributes.name: Ursus Caravan Guard

attributes.content: The next tribe shouldn't be too far from here. I saw someone in the snow.
attributes.name: Ursus Caravan Guard

attributes.content: Sami bestowed upon us snow and ice to cleanse us anew. Sami bestowed upon us mud and soil to inherit blessings.
attributes.name: Ceremony-Conducting Shaman

attributes.content: We wish not to leave, yet nevertheless travel down the streams of departure.
attributes.name: Ceremony-Conducting Shaman

attributes.content: May our loved ones return home, like drops of water returning to the river.
attributes.name: Ceremony-Conducting Shaman

attributes.content: May disaster be kept far away, in the lands you cannot protect.
attributes.name: Ceremony-Conducting Shaman

attributes.content: The Sami Elafias lower their lanterns, bend down to scoop up handfuls of water, and sing along with the shaman in low voices.
As the ship of the dead slowly sinks, one by one, the oil candles are extinguished.
Darkness gradually spreads across the water.
Even if you aren't a member of our tribe, you should still show some basic respect for our ceremonies.
attributes.name: Ceremony-Conducting Shaman

attributes.content: Put down your weapon, hunter with the black bow. Lower your head.
attributes.name: Ceremony-Conducting Shaman

attributes.content: (*whispers*) Look at that hunter over there...
attributes.name: Sami Wetlands Inhabitant

attributes.content: You've seen people like her in the northern icefield, right? Do you think she'll darken our fates–
attributes.name: Sami Wetlands Inhabitant

attributes.content: ...'The more people speak of doom, the clearer it casts its shadow.'
attributes.name: Ceremony-Conducting Shaman

attributes.content: So I will not speak of it.
attributes.name: Ceremony-Conducting Shaman

attributes.content: Someone else will. Eikthyrnir will. But we are absolutely not among those who have the power to speak freely in this land.
attributes.name: Ceremony-Conducting Shaman

attributes.content: This is your final warning, hunter.
attributes.name: Ceremony-Conducting Shaman

attributes.content: Or else we will be forced to take up arms.
attributes.name: Ceremony-Conducting Shaman

attributes.content: W-Wait, hold on! She's just standing guard!
attributes.name: Magallan

attributes.content: Typhon, can't you explain? I'm sure they'll understand!
attributes.name: Magallan

attributes.content: ...Shh.
attributes.name: Typhon

attributes.content: I feel it moving.
attributes.name: Typhon

attributes.content: Out of the way, now.
attributes.name: Typhon

attributes.content: Everyone, leave this place!
attributes.name: Typhon

attributes.content: Half an hour ago...
We're almost there.
attributes.name: Gitano

attributes.content: Phew... Finally, some good news.
attributes.name: Magallan

attributes.content: Didn't think I'd be the one to end up seasick... Err, that is what this is, right?
attributes.name: Magallan

attributes.content: But Gitano, didn't you say you've been away from the tribe ever since they moved? Then how do you know where the burial site is?
attributes.name: Magallan

attributes.content: Look at the wooden fencing over there. It's a warning.
attributes.name: Typhon

attributes.content: Oh...
attributes.name: Magallan

attributes.content: In the wetlands, the waters where a tribe buries their dead are usually off-limits.
attributes.name: Typhon

attributes.content: The fencing serves not only to warn those who are awake, but more importantly, to remind those who are sleeping.
attributes.name: Typhon

attributes.content: Because everyone meets their departed friends and relatives in their dreams. If they aren't careful, it's very easy to wander into these places.
attributes.name: Typhon

attributes.content: I see, I see, fascinating! I'll have to note this one down too.
attributes.name: Magallan

attributes.content: (Takes notes) 'Be careful when dreaming.'
attributes.name: Magallan

attributes.content: Hrmm...
attributes.name: Magallan

attributes.content: (*whispers*) Does that mean I'll get in trouble again if I want to do some research on these waters?
attributes.name: Magallan

attributes.content: Hm. What do you have in mind?
attributes.name: Typhon

attributes.content: It's this here, a beacon. I want to set it up underwater so I can collect some data.
attributes.name: Magallan

attributes.content: Hmm... You said before that this thing can track a location?
attributes.name: Typhon

attributes.content: Yup.
attributes.name: Magallan

attributes.content: Okay. Give it to me.
attributes.name: Typhon

attributes.content: Gitano, can we stop right before that fencing? I'm also getting the sense that something isn't quite right.
attributes.name: Typhon

attributes.content: Go ahead.
attributes.name: Gitano

attributes.content: ...Don't worry. I already foresaw your safety before we left at dusk.
attributes.name: Gitano

attributes.content: Huh? Did I ever ask you to read my fortune?
attributes.name: Magallan

attributes.content: All I remember is eating way too much for lunch and ending up in a food coma right up until we boarded the ship...
attributes.name: Magallan

attributes.content: *sigh*... Nobody forced you to eat all that in one go.
attributes.name: Typhon

attributes.content: There were narcoleptic mushrooms in the soup. We often add a few when people are feeling anxious or uneasy.
attributes.name: Typhon

attributes.content: Ehehe... It sure was tasty.
attributes.name: Magallan

attributes.content: Anyway, thanks Gitano!
attributes.name: Magallan

attributes.content: But it's true that we never asked her for anything...
attributes.name: Typhon

attributes.content: Not that it matters.
attributes.name: Typhon

attributes.content: So how do we set up this beacon?
attributes.name: Typhon

attributes.content: Just toss it into the water, and it'll handle the rest automatically.
attributes.name: Magallan

attributes.content: Toss it? With how much force?
attributes.name: Typhon

attributes.content: No, no force! Just, let go of it and have it sink on its own...
attributes.name: Magallan

attributes.content: Phew...
attributes.name: Magallan

attributes.content: Welp, the beacon's up and running, and the signal looks solid.
attributes.name: Magallan

attributes.content: It has an effective range of about three thousand meters, so we can keep moving– Err, rowing the boat forward.
attributes.name: Magallan

attributes.content: Alright. Now, how am I supposed to make sense of this... gibberish?
attributes.name: Typhon

attributes.content: I'd also like to keep track of the beacon.
attributes.name: Typhon

attributes.content: Oh, that's real easy. Way simpler to understand than all this Sami stuff!
attributes.name: Magallan

attributes.content: Look – over here we have the most basic data: relative coordinates of the beacon's location, water depth, flow speed...
attributes.name: Magallan

attributes.content: But I'm sure you can figure all that out on your own just from experience.
attributes.name: Magallan

attributes.content: Mhm.
attributes.name: Typhon

attributes.content: In other words, it's continuously moving around underwater.
attributes.name: Typhon

attributes.content: It's probably just oscillating back and forth due to undulations in the water flow. These devices have extremely precise positioning.
attributes.name: Magallan

attributes.content: Specimen sampling comes next.
attributes.name: Magallan

attributes.content: My drones are a bit noisy when I put them to work, so I prefer to use this compact beacon to do the preliminary water quality sampling and analysis first.
attributes.name: Magallan

attributes.content: While it's made for scientific investigation, its analysis is based mostly on the water's potability. But in areas not many people visit, even this simple analysis can sometimes produce anomalous results.
attributes.name: Magallan

attributes.content: Take a look–
attributes.name: Magallan

attributes.content: —Hmm?
attributes.name: Magallan

attributes.content: ...The signal disappeared.
attributes.name: Typhon

attributes.content: Think it might've gotten swallowed up by a huge scalecis?
attributes.name: Magallan

attributes.content: Though, we did take that sort of thing into consideration when we designed the beacon. No ordinary wild beast should be able to damage its outer covering...
attributes.name: Magallan

attributes.content: Gitano.
attributes.name: Typhon

attributes.content: Alright, got it.
attributes.name: Gitano

attributes.content: I'll handle the ship for you.
attributes.name: Typhon

attributes.content: Wait a sec, are you going to do another divination?
attributes.name: Magallan

attributes.content: Yeah.
attributes.name: Gitano

attributes.content: But... how many times have you used your Originium Arts, between yesterday and today?
attributes.name: Magallan

attributes.content: Not enough to worry about.
attributes.name: Gitano

attributes.content: Just think of it as me double-checking my work.
attributes.name: Gitano

attributes.content: (Tugs on Magallan's hand)
attributes.name: Typhon

attributes.content: Leave her alone.
attributes.name: Typhon

attributes.content: Aww... Fine.
attributes.name: Magallan

attributes.content: The first time I met Gitano was when I was visiting Iffy at the Rhodes Island Medical Department.
attributes.name: Magallan

attributes.content: At the time, she was in a coma in a hospital bed, and was carted in by the other field operators. They all said her Arts take a heavy toll on her body...
attributes.name: Magallan

attributes.content: Even more reason to leave her alone then.
attributes.name: Typhon

attributes.content: She sensed something, which is why she's trying to read your fortune before you leave.
attributes.name: Typhon

attributes.content: And I agree with her.
attributes.name: Typhon

attributes.content: I've felt a lingering shadow here this whole time.
attributes.name: Typhon

attributes.content: I don't know exactly what she's trying to double-check, but there's no point in trying to avoid an omen of calamity.
attributes.name: Typhon

attributes.content: I just hope she finds whatever is giving her these strange premonitions.
attributes.name: Typhon

attributes.content: —Watch out!
attributes.name: Typhon

attributes.content: The boat tilts sharply to one side, and Typhon pulls Magallan in close just in time to stabilize the ship.
Gitano falls heavily onto the deck, and an intense burst of Arts flashes through her crystal ball.
Gitano!
attributes.name: Magallan

attributes.content: ...Phew.
attributes.name: Gitano

attributes.content: I'm fine.
attributes.name: Gitano

attributes.content: I'm not the same self-defeating, self-destructive person I was years ago. This is just... me trying my best.
attributes.name: Gitano

attributes.content: Well, as long as you're okay! Let me help you up.
attributes.name: Magallan

attributes.content: ...However, try as I might, I couldn't find anything.
attributes.name: Gitano

attributes.content: What did you see in your divination?
attributes.name: Typhon

attributes.content: Fate. The fates of the deceased.
attributes.name: Gitano

attributes.content: But my divination has little in common with Sami's prophecies – it's merely a special kind of Arts. It cannot touch those who have passed.
attributes.name: Gitano

attributes.content: Their fates are pitch-black. Nothing more.
attributes.name: Gitano

attributes.content: Is that the same for everyone?
attributes.name: Typhon

attributes.content: ...No, there's one who hasn't responded to me.
attributes.name: Gitano

attributes.content: Gitano holds up her crystal ball. There is nothing inside it save for the candlelight reflected from the fleet ahead.
He remains silent.
attributes.name: Gitano

attributes.content: That is no fault of the diviner's.
attributes.name: Typhon

attributes.content: We need to hurry and make our way to the front of the fleet.
attributes.name: Typhon

attributes.content: If I'm forced to draw my bow, the boat's going to rock a whole lot, and you two will need to keep it steady.
attributes.name: Typhon

attributes.content: W-Wait, back up! What's going on?
attributes.name: Magallan

attributes.content: The marsh is trying to drag us under.
attributes.name: Typhon

attributes.content: None are safe, living or dead.
attributes.name: Typhon

attributes.content: —What?
attributes.name: Santalla

attributes.content: We don't know a thing! We really don't, so spare us, please!
attributes.name: Ursus Caravan Member

attributes.content: The only one who does is that Liberi who went to Čappat alone. He's the one you're looking for!
attributes.name: Ursus Caravan Member

attributes.content: Those Sami died to save us! But we didn't know what else to do for them, except take their remains back to their hometown!
attributes.name: Ursus Caravan Member

attributes.content: No, that's not what I'm asking...
attributes.name: Santalla

attributes.content: When you took the bodies away, someone was bleeding black blood. Did you witness this yourself?
attributes.name: Santalla

attributes.content: Yes, I saw it with my own eyes.
attributes.name: Ursus Caravan Member

attributes.content: How could I make such a terrible mistake?!
attributes.name: Santalla

attributes.content: The ship! The ship of the dead... What are you doing?!
attributes.name: Sami Wetlands Inhabitant

attributes.content: Using the waves to keep it from sinking any further.
attributes.name: Typhon

attributes.content: You–
attributes.name: Sami Wetlands Inhabitant

attributes.content: Turn the boat around, now.
attributes.name: Typhon

attributes.content: This funeral can no longer continue. I will protect you from the rear.
attributes.name: Typhon

attributes.content: Let's go.
attributes.name: Ceremony-Conducting Shaman

attributes.content: You... Are you sympathizing with the outsider too?
attributes.name: Sami Wetlands Inhabitant

attributes.content: Maybe she's right. Or maybe she's finally lost her mind to the black bow. Either way, she poses just as much danger.
attributes.name: Ceremony-Conducting Shaman

attributes.content: Warriors, protect the fleet from front to back. Stay vigilant.
attributes.name: Ceremony-Conducting Shaman

attributes.content: Don't panic.
attributes.name: Ceremony-Conducting Shaman

attributes.content: Trust that Sami will protect our inner peace. Trust that calamity will never take it from us.
attributes.name: Ceremony-Conducting Shaman

attributes.content: The same goes for you two, Magallan and Gitano.
attributes.name: Typhon

attributes.content: Hurry up.
attributes.name: Typhon

attributes.content: Wait, Typhon... I'd like an explanation. I need an answer.
attributes.name: Gitano

attributes.content: Is it the same as what I saw?
attributes.name: Gitano

attributes.content: Mhm.
attributes.name: Typhon

attributes.content: Too many soldiers from the north are buried here. Their contamination has accumulated, day by day, until it all melded together.
attributes.name: Typhon

attributes.content: And this time, the disaster might've taken some of the dead–
attributes.name: Typhon

attributes.content: —I understand.
attributes.name: Gitano

attributes.content: ...My Arts are supporting the ship of the dead, preventing it from sinking. But that doesn't solve the issue.
attributes.name: Typhon

attributes.content: So don't look back.
attributes.name: Typhon

attributes.content: But—
attributes.name: Gitano

attributes.content: Anything we can do to help?
attributes.name: Magallan

attributes.content: M-My drone has a combat module! If there's going to be fighting, I can help out!
attributes.name: Magallan

attributes.content: No.
attributes.name: Typhon

attributes.content: The dark swamp surges up, and the disaster merges into solid entities that leap towards Typhon from the black waves.
For over a decade, she has seen the same dream again and again. A pitch-black dream.
The Sami say that while asleep, people can free themselves from the shackles of their corporeal forms and meet both the living and the dead.
Typhon has always known that if she could strip away the darkness covering her eyes, she could turn back and take one last look at her mother and father–
Yet, she has never seen anything.
Because a hunter only keeps her eyes on her prey.
Don't look back. That's all.
attributes.name: Typhon

attributes.content: Stay behind them, and keep rowing the ship. I'll handle the rest.
attributes.name: Typhon

attributes.content: Her bowstring is fully drawn. Ancient Arts converge into a single shaft. She takes aim.
The threats on the icefield are numerous. Extreme cold. Waves of snow. Ferocious beasts. Demons. And, in the stories of certain tribes, herself.
Typhon takes this for granted. She carries a contaminated black bow on her back. She was engulfed by the shadows and escaped from them. In the eyes of others, she walks closest to disaster.
Naturally, then, she should be the one to stand between those people and disaster.
Looks like I got the drop on you again.
attributes.name: Typhon

attributes.content: Now, depart from the lands of Sami.
attributes.name: Typhon

attributes.content: —I'll pin you down!
attributes.name: Typhon

attributes.content: The hunter raises her voice as if shouting into the empty marsh.
The bowstring vibrates, and the arrow hurtles towards the water's depths.
Whooooaaaa! The boat's rocking like crazy!
attributes.name: Magallan

attributes.content: Wh-What just happened? Did something fall into the water?
attributes.name: Magallan

attributes.content: —Whoa, it got cold all of a sudden!
attributes.name: Magallan

attributes.content: The hunter's cry receives an answer from the water's surface.
It is a soft murmur in the Sami tongue.
'Water withered, hard ice becomes.'
From the water's depths, it spreads out with the ripples of the falling arrow. In the blink of an eye, the swamp is engulfed in freezing cold.
All is calm, save for the constant crashing sounds from beneath the ice.
...Thank goodness, I made it in time.
attributes.name: Santalla

attributes.content: Thanks, Simone.
attributes.name: Typhon

attributes.content: Did you hear my footsteps?
attributes.name: Santalla

attributes.content: Wherever you go, the snow follows. The wind told me this.
attributes.name: Typhon

attributes.content: Also, you said you'd attend the funeral.
attributes.name: Typhon

attributes.content: Haha, you guys... really do trust me.
attributes.name: Santalla

attributes.content: Naturally. I have a good eye, both for the weather and for people.
attributes.name: Typhon

attributes.content: Simone's here?! We're saved!
attributes.name: Magallan

attributes.content: Hmm, looks like everything's quieting down. Does that mean our predicament is resolved?
attributes.name: Magallan

attributes.content: ...Not yet.
attributes.name: Gitano

attributes.content: No, no, no...
attributes.name: Gitano

attributes.content: Who– What are they? What are those things?
attributes.name: Gitano

attributes.content: *sigh*... I told you not to look back.
attributes.name: Typhon

attributes.content: They are shadows left behind by contaminated corpses.
attributes.name: Typhon

attributes.content: No! Don't come any closer... Those warriors buried beneath the water... Aren't they supposed to be sealed under the ice? Shouldn't they be... resting in peace?
attributes.name: Gitano

attributes.content: The marsh... Why hasn't it calmed down yet?
attributes.name: Gitano

attributes.content: I, I... AAAAAHH!
attributes.name: Gitano

attributes.content: Close your eyes.
attributes.name: Typhon

attributes.content: Magallan, hold her hand.
attributes.name: Typhon

attributes.content: Give her a touch of reality. Just like, uh... just like you always do.
attributes.name: Typhon

attributes.content: Then, steer the ship away.
attributes.name: Typhon

attributes.content: Oh... Um, okay!
attributes.name: Magallan

attributes.content: Gitano... Do you feel any better now?
attributes.name: Magallan

attributes.content: She's calming down.
attributes.name: Santalla

attributes.content: Just like that, Gitano. Listen to me.
attributes.name: Santalla

attributes.content: It's normal to feel fear. But if you continue like this, you will be transformed too.
attributes.name: Santalla

attributes.content: We can seal the bodies, but we cannot seal the shadows that seep from them.
attributes.name: Santalla

attributes.content: So don't blame yourself, and don't force yourself to see things through to the end.
attributes.name: Santalla

attributes.content: Your brother isn't at fault for this disaster, and you certainly aren't either.
attributes.name: Santalla

attributes.content: The disaster simply found us. Or perhaps, we found it.
attributes.name: Santalla

attributes.content: Which is why it awakened.
attributes.name: Santalla

attributes.content: Their ships can't move very quickly. How much time do we have, Simone?
attributes.name: Typhon

attributes.content: Traces of contamination are still all around us. I have no way to tell.
attributes.name: Santalla

attributes.content: Right, so this is why Sami warned the Frost Maple tribe that they had to move away.
attributes.name: Santalla

attributes.content: I can already feel their presence becoming more and more clear.
attributes.name: Typhon

attributes.content: Sounds are vanishing, colors are disappearing, and bodies are melting.
attributes.name: Typhon

attributes.content: But don't worry, it won't affect my aim.
attributes.name: Typhon

attributes.content: ...I've always meant to ask. Are you not afraid?
attributes.name: Santalla

attributes.content: Afraid? Of what?
attributes.name: Typhon

attributes.content: —This way!
attributes.name: Typhon

attributes.content: Good! That's it, Simone! Direct your Arts where my arrows fly!
attributes.name: Typhon

attributes.content: I've pinned down one corner of the shadows. The black blood is oozing out slower.
attributes.name: Typhon

attributes.content: My next arrow will be marked with fluorescent fletchings for you.
attributes.name: Typhon

attributes.content: (Chants softly)
attributes.name: Santalla

attributes.content: Nightmare that terrorizes innocent children... Begone!
attributes.name: Santalla

attributes.content: Crack. Crack. Crack.
The ice beneath her feet splits bit by bit, yet the shadow before her eyes shows no signs of retreating.
Arrow and Arts sink deep into the darkness, the blackness flowing like ink through their consciousness and into reality.
Ah... You really don't show any fear at all.
attributes.name: Santalla

attributes.content: Are you not afraid of the demons?
attributes.name: Santalla

attributes.content: You're not afraid that you'll fail, only to regret it forevermore?
attributes.name: Santalla

attributes.content: Crack. Crack. Crack.
The energy from the Originium Arts seems to pour endlessly into the abyss. Santalla tries to repair the ice, but naturally, it does not respond to her.
—Don't go any further, Simone! It's too dangerous!
attributes.name: Typhon

attributes.content: I know.
attributes.name: Santalla

attributes.content: Only I am at fault. And the responsibility is mine.
attributes.name: Santalla

attributes.content: ...Huh?
attributes.name: Magallan

attributes.content: A premonition. A moment of inspiration. A chill rises from deep within her bones, like a gust of wind from a place where no wind blows.
For some inexplicable reason, Magallan has the urge to turn around.
She wants to see Simone and Typhon's enemies. To check if they are alright.
But all she sees is darkness. An endless darkness.
She remembers the stories she has heard.

Someone was seriously injured in a fierce battle and fell into a deep coma with a high fever. He dreamt he was hanging from a tree, facing off against a pitch-black beast so massive he could not see the whole thing.
A branch pierced the top of his head, and the blood flowing down over his body froze into a sculpture of crimson ice. But the warrior neither moved nor blinked.
Ten days and nights later, the fierce beast retreated, and he awoke from his fever only to find himself lying in the snow, and the wound atop his head fused with a tree branch.
All Sami know this legend, and whenever they speak of experiencing Sami's calling, they will surely bring up this story.
—Aaaaahh!
attributes.name: Magallan

attributes.content: The endless darkness is suddenly torn to shreds by brambles.

Black waves surge from between the cracks of the fractured ice, and the corpses that had begun to melt together reach towards the land with countless hands, but dissolve before they can stain the snow.
Purifying Arts penetrate the fog and shadow, and an entire army of northern warriors emerge from beyond the fencing.
They stand in formation, waiting with weapons in hand. Only one of them crosses the fence to approach.
Brambles spread in the direction his warhammer points—growing, twisting, and forming a ring that isolates the evil spirits. He extends his weapon and the Arts of his soldiers follow.
With no hesitation, no fear of being contaminated, he strides towards the dead, transformed warriors whose faces are no longer distinguishable, and raises his warhammer high.
In a single blow, names both spoken and forgotten are dissipated all at once.
The bright moonlight reflects across the forest's fresh snow.
Those are... Treescar warriors.
attributes.name: Sami Wetlands Inhabitant

attributes.content: Eikthyrnir has come.
attributes.name: Sami Wetlands Inhabitant

attributes.content: Thank you... You saved our lives.
attributes.name: Sami Wetlands Inhabitant

attributes.content: We didn't expect warriors of the north to come so far south, especially not so close to the Columbians.
attributes.name: Sami Wetlands Inhabitant

attributes.content: Eikthyrnir came here to rescue the Sami who had moved south. He just happened to arrive sooner because he received a request for help.
attributes.name: Treescar Tribe Warrior

attributes.content: ...I thought that rumor was false.
attributes.name: Sami Wetlands Inhabitant

attributes.content: Unfortunately, all the rumors about him are true.
attributes.name: Treescar Tribe Warrior

attributes.content: Only a few tribes lack Snowpriests, so you may recall that it has been more than a decade since anyone in our tribe has been touched by Sami's calling.
attributes.name: Ceremony-Conducting Shaman

attributes.content: When I first returned to my tribe from the north, it was precisely because we were unable to actively predict Catastrophes or anticipate the disaster. Facing crises from every direction, we had no choice but to retain more soldiers.
attributes.name: Ceremony-Conducting Shaman

attributes.content: Now, even survival is difficult for us. Continuing to head south, perhaps even leaving Sami lands, is but a desperate measure.
attributes.name: Ceremony-Conducting Shaman

attributes.content: Eikthyrnir, it is not for a lack of love for this land that we leave, but rather a matter of necessity.
attributes.name: Ceremony-Conducting Shaman

attributes.content: You harbor resentment in your heart.
attributes.name: Eikthyrnir

attributes.content: How could I ever resent the very Sami that has given us everything?
attributes.name: Ceremony-Conducting Shaman

attributes.content: You cannot change my mind.
attributes.name: Eikthyrnir

attributes.content: We cannot back down.
attributes.name: Eikthyrnir

attributes.content: You have already experienced the demons' depredations of nature. Living and dead alike are seized all the same.
attributes.name: Eikthyrnir

attributes.content: Fate has thrust them upon the Sami, and we must face them and endure.
attributes.name: Eikthyrnir

attributes.content: ...You said the same, during the snowstorm back then.
attributes.name: Ceremony-Conducting Shaman

attributes.content: 'Do not retreat. Do not move. We will stop the snowstorm and block the disaster north of the Fjal Vetrtonn.'
attributes.name: Ceremony-Conducting Shaman

attributes.content: After the November hunt, the snowstorm did indeed stop. The line of black snow never crossed the other side of the mountain.
attributes.name: Eikthyrnir

attributes.content: Then you understand why there is no need for any Samijod to flee. You merely speak for your tribe, as well as all those who are anxious because they cannot receive Sami's revelation.
attributes.name: Eikthyrnir

attributes.content: But what we advocate for is sweeping away that layer of fog completely.
attributes.name: Eikthyrnir

attributes.content: No, Eikthyrnir. What you're doing flies in the face of everything we've experienced in Sami, passed down from generation to generation.
attributes.name: Ceremony-Conducting Shaman

attributes.content: We all know why only the most elite warriors travel to the northern lands.
attributes.name: Ceremony-Conducting Shaman

attributes.content: When we become aware of the demons' traces, we become conduits for them. We fear, and as such our weak hearts become their seedbeds.
attributes.name: Ceremony-Conducting Shaman

attributes.content: The more who are aware of this evil, the harder the next battle becomes.
attributes.name: Ceremony-Conducting Shaman

attributes.content: Nobody is above fear, but anyone can conquer it.
attributes.name: Eikthyrnir

attributes.content: That takes thousands of battles!
attributes.name: Ceremony-Conducting Shaman

attributes.content: Indeed, it takes thousands of battles.
attributes.name: Eikthyrnir

attributes.content: The mountains will once again become an indomitable line of defense, just as they were many years ago, before fear penetrated the hearts of the Sami.
attributes.name: Eikthyrnir

attributes.content: We will never leave, and the Sami will never die out. No matter how many generations we must stand guard, it will be the disaster itself that dies first.
attributes.name: Eikthyrnir

attributes.content: Woohoo, I got a pic.
attributes.name: Magallan

attributes.content: Of Eikthyrnir? What makes him photo-worthy?
attributes.name: Typhon

attributes.content: He's the most authoritative warrior of the north, in the hearts of the Sami.
attributes.name: Magallan

attributes.content: That'll be very important to know on future research expeditions!
attributes.name: Magallan

attributes.content: Although... he doesn't seem like the most easygoing guy. But you never know, maybe someone will come along who really wants to partner with him?
attributes.name: Magallan

attributes.content: Besides, what he just said to the other Sami should be recorded.
attributes.name: Magallan

attributes.content: What the silent mountain warriors know about the icefield, as well as how they combat the disaster, are all valuable data!
attributes.name: Magallan

attributes.content: And what was that word they used for the disaster? And... Andsko...
attributes.name: Magallan

attributes.content: 'Andskotarnir.' It means 'enemy.'
attributes.name: Typhon

attributes.content: Hmm... I feel like I've heard it before somewhere. Let me write it down for now.
attributes.name: Magallan

attributes.content: So basically, for the Sami, only the disasters from the icefield are considered enemies?
attributes.name: Magallan

attributes.content: *sigh*... If only we just could listen in, I wouldn't have to go through all this trouble of sending in a drone up close.
attributes.name: Magallan

attributes.content: Luckily, you taught me some tricks about camouflaging yourself so you don't alert your prey–
attributes.name: Magallan

attributes.content: —Whoops. It got shot down.
attributes.name: Magallan

attributes.content: But it should still be salvageable! Once we get to Čappat, I can probably find a colleague from Rhine Lab to fix it.
attributes.name: Magallan

attributes.content: ...Consider yourself lucky then.
attributes.name: Typhon

attributes.content: Hehe.
attributes.name: Magallan

attributes.content: By the way, you're clearly fighting against the same thing, but they treat you like an outsider just because of your weapon?
attributes.name: Magallan

attributes.content: Mm. Black bow aside, it's probably because of Arges.
attributes.name: Typhon

attributes.content: A lot of people see her as a madwoman, as they're quite familiar with the Cyclopes who live in seclusion in the Fjal Vetrtonn.
attributes.name: Typhon

attributes.content: They believe that, as a Cyclops, she should never have walked out of that cave. Should never have made contact with so many people.
attributes.name: Typhon

attributes.content: (In Sami) One who foresees fate will easily twist the fates of others.
attributes.name: Typhon

attributes.content: (In Sami) One who... foresees fate... Ack.
attributes.name: Magallan

attributes.content: In their eyes, I am someone who's had her fate twisted. Like... branches that have been artificially grafted together.
attributes.name: Typhon

attributes.content: Trees like that will not grow properly.
attributes.name: Typhon

attributes.content: But you seem perfectly fine to me!
attributes.name: Magallan

attributes.content: Mhm. I think so too.
attributes.name: Typhon

attributes.content: Oh, Simone.
attributes.name: Magallan

attributes.content: Please, let me check if you two are okay.
attributes.name: Santalla

attributes.content: This birdbrain over here seems fine enough. She just won't stop bouncing around.
attributes.name: Typhon

attributes.content: Ehh?
attributes.name: Magallan

attributes.content: Do you disagree? You act as if nothing happened.
attributes.name: Typhon

attributes.content: Well, I guess that's true.
attributes.name: Magallan

attributes.content: Oh right, Simone.
attributes.name: Typhon

attributes.content: What is it?
attributes.name: Santalla

attributes.content: I didn't have time to answer your question earlier. I'll do it now.
attributes.name: Typhon

attributes.content: —I am scared.
attributes.name: Typhon

attributes.content: ...Hmm.
attributes.name: Santalla

attributes.content: But when I'm on the hunt, I have other things to think about.
attributes.name: Typhon

attributes.content: Where to aim. The speed of the wind. Deducing where my prey will be. When my head is full of these thoughts, I have no time to be scared.
attributes.name: Typhon

attributes.content: I know that I must overcome, again and again. My resolve will never be shaken.
attributes.name: Typhon

attributes.content: But just now, when the ice shattered, if I'd been the one to fall through, then that too would be fate's plan.
attributes.name: Typhon

attributes.content: So are you able to calmly confront the torments of fate... because Arges shared her visions with you?
attributes.name: Santalla

attributes.content: No, she's never spoken of them.
attributes.name: Typhon

attributes.content: Haha, that makes me feel better then. The tragic prophecies of a Cyclops should not befall a child like you.
attributes.name: Santalla

attributes.content: Where's Gitano?
attributes.name: Santalla

attributes.content: She left by herself.
attributes.name: Magallan

attributes.content: I don't know where she plans to go, but she said she'll send word to Rhodes Island once she's made up her mind.
attributes.name: Magallan

attributes.content: ...How unfortunate. There was something I wanted to tell her earlier.
attributes.name: Santalla

attributes.content: But she should already understand by now.
attributes.name: Santalla

attributes.content: Oh right! Even though I don't know exactly what's going on, I need to thank you all for resolving the crisis! Gitano too!
attributes.name: Magallan

attributes.content: Wait, what did she do?
attributes.name: Typhon

attributes.content: She was already exhausted by her Arts. And given the terror caused by the disaster, she wouldn't have been able to do anything rash.
attributes.name: Typhon

attributes.content: Oh, she sent a request for help to the nearby tribes yesterday.
attributes.name: Magallan

attributes.content: Just earlier, she told me something in secret... that she felt a vague sense of worry and guilt, so she wanted to ask for help.
attributes.name: Magallan

attributes.content: —Hello there, Mister Snowpriest! Thank you and the other Treescar warriors for helping us today!
attributes.name: Magallan

attributes.content: You're all lifesavers!
attributes.name: Magallan

attributes.content: Child of the Santalla tree, daughter born of the biting cold.
attributes.name: Eikthyrnir

attributes.content: Please do not call me that.
attributes.name: Santalla

attributes.content: You went after the Ursus.
attributes.name: Eikthyrnir

attributes.content: ...So you can see everything.
attributes.name: Santalla

attributes.content: How did it go?
attributes.name: Eikthyrnir

attributes.content: You once hesitated because you longed for the shade beneath the ancient branches, and failed to become a Snowpriest.
attributes.name: Eikthyrnir

attributes.content: If you still wish to live as the old tree's steward, then I have no further questions for you.
attributes.name: Eikthyrnir

attributes.content: My time is limited because of Oripathy.
attributes.name: Santalla

attributes.content: That is no reason for you to lose sight of your goals.
attributes.name: Eikthyrnir

attributes.content: You understand this well, daughter of the Santalla Tree.
attributes.name: Eikthyrnir

attributes.content: You understand the futility of revenge better than anyone else. It is precisely because of that futility that it becomes a never-ending task, one that requires a constant search for new lives to fulfill it.
attributes.name: Eikthyrnir

attributes.content: I... am just an outcast. Hardly worthy of your attention.
attributes.name: Santalla

attributes.content: No one has forgotten the young shaman who was born to command the wind and snow.
attributes.name: Eikthyrnir

attributes.content: Then I'm sure you're quite disappointed now that you've met her in person.
attributes.name: Santalla

attributes.content: Hatred and stone alike took root within this body. She was robbed of an eye, and naturally became blind.
attributes.name: Santalla

attributes.content: No.
attributes.name: Eikthyrnir

attributes.content: She is a warrior, just as in the legends of the past.
attributes.name: Eikthyrnir

attributes.content: 'Bjoda,' 'Andarsár.'
attributes.name: Eikthyrnir

attributes.content: The will of the All-Father has warned us. All that you see serves as a warning.
attributes.name: Eikthyrnir

attributes.content: The mountains raised by Sami are not enough to protect us from the disaster. Our sole enemy encroaches on our land.
attributes.name: Eikthyrnir

attributes.content: Even so, will you continue to wander the icefield, aimlessly seeking vengeance?
attributes.name: Eikthyrnir

attributes.content: Sorry... I need to go to Čappat with my companions.
attributes.name: Santalla

attributes.content: Nobody's left.
attributes.name: Gitano

attributes.content: One more snowstorm, and these fragile houses will disappear.
attributes.name: Gitano

attributes.content: I only had time to see the ruined end. Is this fate showing mercy, or cruelty?
attributes.name: Gitano

attributes.content: Brother, I now know what you saw when you turned back.
attributes.name: Gitano

attributes.content: The wandering Elafia sits at the water's edge.
She leans down, wanting to cup the water to her face to wash away the dirty melted snow.
When she approaches the surface, shadows block the shimmering light, and she suddenly sees a wine flagon at the bottom of the water.
She recognizes the aged flagon as well as the prayer inscribed on it.
'Bestow upon the Myrkwood sacred purity; O Travelers, retrieve your innocent sight, those eyes that discern fate.'
'Bestow upon my home a lasting tranquility; My people, the dreamland is silent as falling snow.'
Sleep now. For one day, we will finally be able to return to that peaceful dream.
